meanings.definition: Relating to the application of the principles of the natural sciences, especially biology and physiology, to clinical medicine.
meanings.sent1: The hospital invested in new biomedical equipment to improve patient care.
meanings.sent2: She conducted groundbreaking research in the biomedical field.
meanings.sent3: The doctor's lab coat was so advanced, it looked like a futuristic biomedical suit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a complex network of interconnected biomedical concepts.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by the intricate details of the biomedical diagrams.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the field of medical science that deals with the relationship between biology and medicine.
meanings.sent1: The university offered a specialized course in biomedical studies.
meanings.sent2: His career focused on developing new biomedical technologies.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a secret interest in biomedical research.
meanings.sent4: The bond between biology and medicine was like a delicate biomedical thread.
meanings.sent5: The conference showcased the latest advancements in biomedical research.
